payload.content: Andrew Krapivin, an undergraduate, invented a new kind of hash table that overturned a 40-year-old conjecture and a long-held hypothesis about the speed limits of hash tables.

content: Andrew Krapivin, an undergraduate, invented a new kind of hash table that overturned a 40-year-old conjecture and a long-held hypothesis about the speed limits of hash tables.

payload.content: A team at Google Quantum AI has demonstrated that scaling up quantum error correction using the “surface code” approach can make useful quantum computers possible, addressing the issue of finicky and error-prone qubits.

name: A team at Google Quantum AI has demonstrated that scaling up quantum error corre
content: A team at Google Quantum AI has demonstrated that scaling up quantum error correction using the “surface code” approach can make useful quantum computers possible, addressing the issue of finicky and error-prone qubits.

payload.content: In theoretical computer science, time and space (memory) are considered the two fundamental resources of computation.

name: In theoretical computer science, time and space (memory) are considered the two
content: In theoretical computer science, time and space (memory) are considered the two fundamental resources of computation.

payload.content: MIT researcher Ryan Williams discovered that memory is significantly more powerful in computation than previously understood, challenging the long-held assumption that algorithms require roughly proportional amounts of space to runtime.

content: MIT researcher Ryan Williams discovered that memory is significantly more powerful in computation than previously understood, challenging the long-held assumption that algorithms require roughly proportional amounts of space to runtime.
